review: Works amazingly well for Amazon content. Seriously, the video quality for Amazon content is VERY good. Unfortunately, the same cannot be said when viewing Netflix content on the Fire TV. This is close to becoming a deal breaker for me. Netflix looks horrible on the Fire TV. I've read on various websites that this is a problem with the Netflix app which was developed for the Fire TV. However, this app has not been updated since October 2014. My internet speed is stellar, so that's not the issue. Everything other than Netflix comes through clean, fast, and in high quality. But Netflix continues to have buffering issues and poor video quality. These issues don't seem to come up a lot on the Fire TV reviews here, but if you search the internet you'll see that this is something that people have been complaining about for quite some time. It seems that an updated Netflix app that was optimized for the Fire TV would take care of these issues once and for all, but apparently this has not been a priority for either Amazon or Netflix. That's a shame, because that's a serious blemish on an otherwise outstanding device. Because let's face it, Netflix is by far the leader when it comes to online video content. If that content cannot be accessed in an acceptable manner through this device than I have to wonder how useful it really is.If Amazon (or Netflix) can update the Netflix app so that the video quality at least matches that of Amazon Instant Video, I'd be happy to revise my rating and review, but until that time I have a hard time recommending this device to anyone...
